title: How Dangerous is Ocean Plastic? Insights From Global Experts on the ...
body: How Dangerous is Ocean Plastic? Insights From Global Experts on the Greatest Threat to Marine Wildlife Written By George Leonard Chief Scientist Nick Mallos Vice President of Conservation, Ocean Plastics Stay Current! Enter your email and never miss an update Help save our ocean
readable_content:
- OceanConservancy (2023-12-08): The article provides insights from experts on the impact of ocean plastic on marine wildlife. The study ranks the relative threat of different debris items to seabirds, marine mammals, and sea turtles, with derelict fishing gear identified as the greatest overall threat due to entanglement. Plastic bags and other everyday plastic items were also found to have significant impact. The study emphasizes the need for collective action from individuals, NGOs, governments, and the private sector to address the ocean plastics problem.

Learn more about the work being done by Ocean Conservancy to protect marine wildlife and promote a trash-free ocean.
summary:
The article discusses the significant impact of ocean plastic, particularly derelict fishing gear and everyday plastic items, on marine wildlife. It emphasizes the need for collective action from various stakeholders to address the issue. This conveys a sense of urgency and a call to action to protect marine wildlife and promote a trash-free ocean.

Sentiment: 0.8
